Experience Process Engineer Oxford Instruments April 2009  –  February 2015  (5 years 11 months) Carteret, NJ Instrumental in uncovering the root cause for wire breakages requiring extensive use of SEM and Compound microscopes. Combined & conditioned large amounts of historical data from multiple sources using SQL. Designed custom charts to facilitate multivariate dataset analysis, leading to an improved build process. 
 
Developed an Excel based QA spool approval database & dashboard that captured over 80% more quality defects. 
 
Led a restructuring effort that repaired an underdeveloped legacy database (SQL) resulting in improved consistency and reliability while infusing team confidence in the engineering and product data. 
 
Designed a novel decoder wheel that reduced the etching process time by over 50%. 
 
Persuaded management to replace the existing textual based work instructions with visual work instructions; then designed and implemented the software and hardware infrastructure to automate the conversion process. 
 
Successfully converted numerous manufacturing work instructions & product routers into a visual format while integrating current “Tribal Knowledge”; ensuring consistent work, and bolstering confidence among operators. 
 
Performed daily incoming inspections on machined parts, ensuring compliance with the specifications while successfully coordinating with management to resolve non-conformities with the supplier. Freelance Consultant Wallflower Designs October 2007  –  2009  (2 years) Clifton NJ Managed the acquisition and retention marketing efforts through Google AdWords, SEO, & e-mail promotions. 
Redesigned the e-commerce web site (www.faigie.com), dramatically improving its visual impact & usability. Consulting Engineer Nanologix January 2004  –  October 2007  (3 years 10 months) Hubbard, OH Produced detailed models & schematics for solar array structures using Solid Works.  
Developed methods for low-cost hydrogen production. Built-up a research laboratory (<$10K), established key business relationships, and exceeded expectations by generating hydrogen in under 4 months. Product Engineer JEM America Corp. October 2002  –  July 2004  (1 year 10 months) Fremont, CA Recruited to provide expert advice and support to lead the company in becoming Intel's preferred vertical probe card supplier for their next generation logic and memory devices. Targeted areas of improvement included: 
 
* Transition to data-driven decision-making 
* Establishment of product support services	 
* Data modeling and presentation 
* "Effective meetings" training	 
* Technology road map development 
* Design rule development	 
 
A true multidisciplinary endeavor: Acted as both an Applications & Field Service Engineer, successfully leading clients through product definition, design, and first article phases. Effectively delivered development summaries and numerous on-site technical sales presentations, while guiding the customer through the selection process. 
 
KEY PROJECTS AND ACHIEVEMENTS: 
Designed low cost vertical probing solutions for Chip Scale Packaged devices, reducing production costs by over 50% and greatly simplifying the repair process. Defined and developed all manufacturing requirements and processes, including design rules, automation tools, assembly and repair process specifications, and training material. 
Brought together critical 3rd party vendors to facilitate the best and most appropriate usage of the company's products within the customers' unique test environment.  
Coordinated multiple DOE's among our vendors, customers, and the company's international design centers. 
Helped our customers refine their DOE models to give meaningful results while contributing to the statistical analysis. 
Developed Excel-based automated data analysis tools to better understand probe contact performance and aid in the manufacturing processes. 
Created a probe card design tracking database allowing the company to more efficiently track design changes & facilitate allocation of design work within the team.  
Led multiple ISO9001:2000 audits, helping the company to achieve its 1st and continued certification. Mathematics Teacher Baltimore County Public Schools January 2001  –  January 2002  (1 year 1 month) Baltimore, MD Returned to the United States, taking a short-term position to re-establish professional contacts. Manufacturing Process Engineer Intel Corporation August 1998  –  July 2000  (2 years) Israel Served as Project Manager during Intel's Fab18 ramp-up. Successfully managed the complete installation and operational capability of all probe card repair modules including: metrology tools, optical inspection stations, cleaning and storage stations, operating and PM specifications, process / RFC / knowledge databases, and the quality assurance infrastructure (compliant with Intel's "Copy Exactly" methodology). 
 
Led and trained a multi-shift four-person team of technicians within 'Probe Card Repair' to support the startup of Intel's most technically advanced wafer fabrication facility. 
Assumed ownership of the probe card forecasting and ordering process, ensuring Just-In-Time availability. Even with frequent product changes, maintained lowest inventory overhead across all factory sites, resulting in savings of $60K+. 
Provided engineering insight and repair process training to technicians covering hardware, software, and theory of operation on all probe card repair tools.  
Defined the Virtual Factory 'Best known method' for performing probe tip measurements giving better operational flexibility to team engineers and technicians. 
Assumed carousel (probe card storage) project leadership resulting in a successful installation and savings of $30K through negotiations and optimizations. 
Challenged the status quo by re-designing vertical storage unit fixtures using local materials and labor to reduce the total cost by over $2K. 
Creatively negotiated with vendors to obtain the most appropriate and value-driven technical support for all probe card repair tools. 
Represented Intel-Israel in three separate international Joint Engineering Teams. Process Quality Engineer Intel Corporation February 1997  –  August 1998  (1 year 7 months) Israel Developed, and implemented a proprietary EXCEL / VB / ACCESS based comprehensive tracking system monitoring probe card quality and performance statistics (Prober correlation, MTBF, MTTR, EOL, and more), resulting in superior efficiency in data analysis. 
Designed and performed scrub over-travel characterization experiments that led to increased probe card life and expenditure savings of over$100K/year. 
Successfully conducted tooling and process quality audits, both within the company and at international vendor sites, in preparation of the company's technology roadmap (Compliant to ISO9001 standards). 
Collaborated with a multi-national team of Engineers developing a new chipset process by implementing an improved probe card cleaning method and redesigning them to match on-site tooling configurations. 
Successfully installed new metrology tools ($100K+) and upgraded existing tools to meet next generation process demands while increasing probe card repair throughput.

Assembled and troubleshoot lead tinning systems. 
Won high praise from customer for meticulous wiring work. Experience Manufacturing Process Engineer Intel Corporation September 2007  –  March 2015  (7 years 7 months) Chandler, AZ Was in charge of preparing for and executing New Product Introductions (NPI's), as well as assisting manufacturing with process control systems issues and equipment programming-related issues in order to maintain smooth operation of the manufacturing lines with maximum tool availability and minimum set up and quality issues, thus gaining much experience in multi-tasking, equipment trouble shooting, and being a solid, pragmatic decision maker constantly vigilant of process improvement opportunities.  
 
•	Operated, repaired and programmed different types of pick and place equipment for NPIs setting up NPIs for high volume manufacturing under high stress situations.  
•	Co-owned and organized the NPI Working Group, assigning NPI's to other manufacturing engineers, tracking their progress and preventing NPI hold ups due to missing collaterals or incoherent programming 
•	Was in charge of ordering high-risk collaterals for pathfinding products, and creating Control Chart settings, as well as scrubbing BOMs.  
•	Equipment owner for the Programming Management System (PMS) for middle of line factory module.  
•	Worked with and led Automation and Software Engineer managers, as well as other Process and Product engineers in revamping this system for a new process equipment line earning Factory honors. 
•	Performed careful time studies as lead of Black Belt project to demonstrate savings due to automation improvements that reduced set up times, thus increasing link availability by 2% with savings of $850,000/yr over 4 years.  
•	Trained Manufacturing Technicians in being proficient at operating an entirely new manufacturing process and assembly line, developing a strong rapport with manufacturing personnel.  
•	Worked with manufacturing supervisors to make prompt risk decisions in keeping the lines up as needed, getting involved in cannibalization and bypassing.  
•	Increased shift’s output and yield results from 4th best to 2nd best over 2014, and 1st best over Q4’15.  
 
 Process Engineering Intel Corporation June 2004  –  September 2007  (3 years 4 months) Chandler, AZ Project manager in charge of certifying product platforms through revision levels achieving stability and capability of key process parameters making use of, and updating FMEA tables until ramping up in the Intel factories occurred, also applying 6sigma DMAIC principles to stream lines processes, and in charge of meeting yield targets.  
•	Successfully certified the server product medium form factor platforms (medium server applications, Xeon 4/8) from technology inception to factory product launch and customer shipments.  
•	Also owned large form factor platform (large server applications, Itanium2) through factory product pre-launch, leading quality, material, and manufacturing engineers to complete mitigation of all risks for high-volume-manufacturing.  
•	Was in charge of managing the installation of a dual lane link, supervising equipment, and facility engineers in carrying out safety, and data collection installation procedures.  
•	Led a Thermal Degradation Task Force which disposed $75 million worth of product. Issue ultimately pinned to a material defect from an external supplier which established a new set of PCS charts from suppliers. 
•	Led a revamping effort of fusing and creating all new set of SPC charts (about 100 charts in total) for the module, being in charge of all large-form factor platforms, thus minimizing variability.  
•	Improved Cpk of thermal degradation output parameter by 500%, and reject levels were reduced by 75% to 5% above target, thus meeting revision level requirements through product launch in the high-volume factories.  
•	Co-owner of a new lid supplier qualification Preliminary and Final White Paper for small form factor dual die (DD). Owned follow up WPs to establish new lid dimension specifications in order to improve thermal degradation.  
•	The qualification of these WP's also permitted maintaining a thinner metal thermal interface thus saving $1M in material costs over the life of the product.

Summary I love to work with people, and especially to find and eliminate frustrations in business operations. I believe that technical work is challenging enough to not have to add complexities in how it gets done to the mix! I've been in industry for 15+ years, and thrive on new experiences and meeting new people. 
 
As the founder and principal of Andrea Jones Consulting, I help businesses eliminate waste in their operations and processes. Wastes of time, unnecessary rework, standardizing work (same each time), clarifying Roles and Responsibilities. My clients are the experts in the product or service they provide, but I help them get it done as efficiently as possible. In other words, clients provide the "what," but I help with the "how." 
 
Our focus at AJC is to enable organizations to effectively implement work given the unique culture in which companies operate, and with the *actual* employees in the organization. My personal expertise is Process Improvement, but at AJC we can do all the following: 
 
•Project Management 
•Process Design, Evaluation, Improvement for multiple segments including manufacturing, operations, general business, and services. 
•Operational Efficiency 
•Technical Training 
•Quality Review
